s110: Sixth. Jing Ke sent Gongsun Qing to reprimand Qi, executed Qing.
s111: Sixth. Attacked and took Dang, obtained six thousand troops, together with previous forces totaling nine thousand.
s121: Seventh. Attacked and took Xiayi, then attacked Feng, but Feng did not fall. Heard Xiang Liang had many troops, went to request him to attack Feng.
s128: Eighth. Liang attacked and killed Jing Ke and Qin Jia, then entered Xue, troops numbering over one hundred thousand.
s131: Eighth. Pei Gong went to Xue to see Xiang Liang, Liang increased Pei Gong's troops by five thousand, attacked Feng, took it. Yong Chi fled to Wei.
s133: Eighth. Lin Ji was in crisis, Zhou Shi went to Qi and Chu to request aid.
s147: Chu Huai Wang beginning, capital at Xutai, former Huai Wang's grandson, Liang established him.
s148: Tenth. Liang sought the Chu Huai Wang's grandson, found him among the common people, established him as Chu king.
s150: Tenth. Dan rescued Lin Ji, Zhang Han killed Tian Dan. Rong fled to Dong'e.
s151: Tenth. Pei Gong went to Xue and together established Chu Huai Wang.
s153: Tenth. Jiu committed suicide, Lin Ji surrendered to Qin.
s157: Second. Chen Ying became Zhu Guo.
s158: Eleventh. Great rain, for three months stars were not seen.
s160: Qi established Tian Jia as king, Qin urgently besieged Dong'e.
s161: Eleventh. Pei Gong and Xiang Yu went north to rescue Dong'e, defeated Qin army at Puyang, east slaughtered Chengyang.
s163: Jiu's younger brother Bao fled to Dong'e.
s168: Twelfth. Rescued Dong'e, defeated Qin army, following victory to Dingtao, Xiang Liang showed arrogance.
